meanings.definition: A hormone that stimulates the production of red blood cells in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent1: Erythropoietins help make more red blood cells in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes use erythropoietins to boost red blood cell production.
meanings.sent3: The little erythropoietins in the body are like tiny red blood cell cheerleaders!
meanings.sent4: Her body's erythropoietins worked tirelessly, like a dedicated team of construction workers building red blood cells.
meanings.sent5: Imagine erythropoietins as tiny red blood cell boosters, encouraging growth and vitality.

meanings.definition: Pharmaceutical drugs that mimic the action of natural erythropoietins.
meanings.sent1: Athletes sometimes misuse erythropoietins to enhance performance.
meanings.sent2: Erythropoietins in medicine can help patients with certain blood disorders.
meanings.sent3: The fake erythropoietins in the drug were like impostors trying to fool the body.
meanings.sent4: In the world of medicine, erythropoietins act as clever mimics, fooling the body into producing more red blood cells.
meanings.sent5: The pharmaceutical erythropoietins are like little copycats, imitating the natural hormone's effects.
